sn6.12:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.
sn6.12:1.3: Then, late at night, the beautiful Brahmā Sahampati, lighting up the entire Vulture’s Peak, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side,
sn6.12:1.4: and recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn6.12:2.1: “The banana tree is destroyed by its own fruit,
sn6.12:2.2: as are the bamboo and the reed.
